StatusCode#

Overview#

This module provides Hyperion’s basic low-level functionality for representing errors. This functionality includes defining the basic requirements for status code domain types, status codes, and the machinery for working with them.

Status code domains (in code, StatusCodeDomain s) represent domains, or categories, from which potential errors can occur. For example, PosixDomain, Win32Domain, and NTDomain are all StatusCodeDomain s that represent errors that can occur from POSIX functions and Windows’s Win32 and NT subsystems, respectively. StatusCodeDomain s provide the functionality to convert from low-level error codes from their respective domain to textual error messages those codes represent, check whether a given code represents success or failure, and convert a code from its domain to the GenericDomain’s hyperion::error::Errno (if applicable).

Examples#

Using the System Domain#
 1// The system domain is the status code domain associated with general system library errors
 2// (ie errors from the POSIX and C standard libraries on UNIX, or the Win32 library on Windows).
 3#include <Hyperion/error/SystemDomain.h>
 4auto example_checked_add(hyperion::i32 lhs, hyperion::i32 rhs, hyperion::i32* out_val)
 5    noexcept -> hyperion::error::SystemStatusCode {
 6
 7    // if rhs + lhs > std::numeric_limits<i32>::max(), the operation will overflow, so we return
 8    // an error code
 9    if((std::numeric_limits<hyperion::i32>::max() - lhs) > rhs) {
10        //
11        if constexpr(std::same_as<hyperion::error::Win32Domain, hyperion::error::SystemDomain>) {
12            return hyperion::error::SystemStatusCode(ERROR_INVALID_PARAMETER)
13        }
14        else {
15            return hyperion::error::SystemStatusCode(EDOM)
16        }
17
18    }
19
20    *out_val = lhs + rhs;
21    return hyperion::error::SystemStatusCode(
22        hyperion::error::SystemStatusCode::domain_type::success_value());
23}
24
25auto use_checked_add() noexcept -> void {
26    using hyperion::operator""_i32;
27    const auto lhs = 18_i32;
28    const auto rhs = 24_i32;
29    auto out = 0_i32;
30
31    auto result = example_checked_add(lhs, rhs, &out);
32    if(hyperion::error::SystemDomain::is_error(result)) {
33        hyperion::eprintln("checked add was an error:\nerror {}: {}",
34                           result.code(), result.message());
35        return;
36    }
37
38    hyperion::println("checked add result: {}", out);
39}
Creating Your Own StatusCodeDomain#
 1 #include <Hyperion/Error.h>
 2 namespace my_namespace {
 3     // create an enum we use to represent our low-level status codes
 4     enum class MyErrorCategory {
 5         0 = Success,
 6         1 = BadThing,
 7         2 = ReallyBadThing,
 8         -1 = Unknown
 9     };
10 } // namespace my_namespace
11
12 // hyperion provides this macro to automate the generation of the boilerplate needed for a
13 // `StatusCodeDomain`. This automatically generates the class definition, overloaded definitions
14 // of `make_status_code_domain`, shorthand aliases for `StatusCode`, `ErrorCode`, and `Error`
15 // instantiations for the domain, and a static assert ensuring `StatusCodeDomain`'s requirements
16 // are met by the generated code
17 STATUS_CODE_DOMAIN(
18     MyErrorDomain, // The name of the `StatusCodeDomain` class
19     My, // The root-name of the `StatusCodeDomain`, used to prefix aliases for
20              // `StatusCode<MyErrorDomain>` and `ErrorCode<MyErrorDomain>`, ie:
21              // `using MyStatusCode = StatusCode<MyErrorDomain>;`
22     my_namespace, // the namespace to place the `StatusCodeDomain` class declaration in
23     my_namespace::MyErrorCategory, // the value type of the `StatusCodeDomain`
24     true, // whether codes of this domain are convertible to codes of the generic domain
25           // generally, you should at least provide conversions for your success and unknown
26           // values, but it isn't necessary
27     "029ddb93-2245-ab31-bc89-928db01aefb5", // The UUID of the domain
28     "MyErrorDomain", // The name of the domain class, as a string
29     my_namespace::MyErrorCategory::Success, // The domain's success value
30     my_namespace::MyErrorCategory::Unknown, // The domain's official value for unknown errors
31     // Function converting a `value_type` (ie a `my_namespace::MyErrorCategory`) into its
32     // associated error message
33     [](value_type code) noexcept -> std::string_view {
34         if(code == value_type::Success) {
35             return "Success";
36         }
37         if(code == value_type::BadThing) {
38             return "A Bad Thing Happened!";
39         }
40         if(code == value_type::ReallyBadThing) {
41             return "A Really Bad Thing Happened!";
42         }
43
44         return "Unknown error";
45     },
46     // if codes of this domain are convertible to codes in the generic domain, provide a
47     // function converting a `value_type` to a `hyperion::error::GenericStatusCode`.
48     // Otherwise, this parameter can be omitted.
49     [](value_type code) noexcept -> hyperion::error::GenericStatusCode {
50         if(code == value_type::Success) {
51             return make_status_code(hyperion::error::Errno::Success);
52         }
53
54         return make_status_code(hyperion::error::Errno::Unknown);
55     });
56
57 // specialize `status_code_enum_info` to register our `my_namespace::MyErrorCategory` enum as
58 // the value type for a `StatusCodeDomain`, specifically, our `my_namespace::MyErrorDomain` domain
59 template<>
60 struct hyperion::error::status_code_enum_info<my_namespace::MyErrorCategory> {
61     using domain_type [[maybe_unused]] = my_namespace::MyErrorDomain;
62     static constexpr bool value = true;
63 }
